title: Boston Legacy FC sign Boston College midfielder Sophia Lowenberg
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Sports News During her four seasons at Boston College, Lowenberg scored seven goals and provided two assists.
Boston Legacy FC announce the signing of Sophia Lowenberg (Boston Legacy FC).
As Boston Legacy FC prepare for their inaugural season in the NWSL, they announced the signing of midfielder Sophia Lowenberg on Wednesday.

title: Prosecutors say alleged Woburn ATM bomber looked up articles about blast
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Christopher Silva is due for arraignment next week on a charge of maliciously damaging property used in interstate commerce.

title: Drake Maye takes home AFC Offensive Player of the Week honors
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Drake Maye threw for 282 yards and two touchdowns in Monday's win over the Giants.
Drake Maye is a top contender for NFL MVP honors this season.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Ryan December 3, 2025 | 2:38 PM 1 minute to read After helping the Patriots win their 10th-straight game with a lopsided victory over the Giants on Monday, Drake Maye was named AFC Offensive Player of the Week on Wednesday afternoon.

title: What’s your Spotify ‘listening age’ for 2025? Tell us your Wrapped results.
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Tell Us How close was Spotify to guessing your actual age?

Illustration by Kelly Chan December 3, 2025 | 2:22 PM 1 minute to read It’s that time of year again: Spotify Wrapped 2025 has officially dropped and music lovers are digging into the listening moments that defined their year.
Launched in 2015, Wrapped highlights nearly a full year of your activity across music, podcasts, and audiobooks.

title: Warning of 13% spike for homeowners, Wu renews push for contentious tax proposal

bullets: Local News Mayor Michelle Wu wants to shift more of Boston's tax burden onto commercial property owners.

title: 74-year-old Texas woman living in Mass. pleads guilty to distributing 150,000 doses of fentanyl

bullets: Crime Patricia Parker maintained she was unaware some of the pills she was packaging contained fentanyl.

title: Celtics players and coaches praise rookie Hugo González for defensive efforts
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics "I just see him being a dog.
" Hugo Gonzalez playing against the Memphis Grizzlies in preseason this summer (Brandon Dill/AP Photo).

While Jaylen Brown’s season-high 42 points was the main headline of the Celtics’ 123-117 victory over the Knicks, it was a rookie’s defensive performance that helped overcome a talented New York team.
